questions.question: What are the three rules of epidemics?

answers.answer: The Law of the Few, the Stickiness Factor and the Power of Context
The Law of the Few, the Stickiness Factor and the Strength of Content
The Law of the Scarce, the Fusion Factor and the Power of Context
The Law of the Few, the Fusion Factor and the Strength of Context

questions.explanation: The three rules of epidemics are 'The Law of the Few,' 'the Stickiness Factor,' and 'the Power of Context' because these factors collectively explain how trends and behaviors spread through a population.

questions.question: A fad can be described as the direction that some form of behaviour develops in a large population and this behaviour takes long to fade away.
questions.explanation: A fad is typically characterized by a rapid rise in popularity and a relatively quick decline, not a behavior that takes a long time to fade away.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option.

answers.answer: A trend can only be inferred from one point
A change can only be a trend when a statistical test confirms it
You can draw a straight line from the first point to the last in your data series
Trends begin and end only at the areas you consider in your dataset

questions.explanation: A change can only be considered a trend when a statistical test confirms it because trends are based on data and require statistical validation to ensure their significance.

questions.question: Diffusion of Innovation can be described as the process in which an innovation is spread around through different channels in an economic system.
questions.explanation: The Diffusion of Innovation refers to the spread of new ideas and technologies, not necessarily within an economic system.

questions.question: The Technology Adoption Lifecycle:

answers.answer: Is a sociological model that describes the rejection of an innovation
Is an economic model that describes how and when an innovation is accepted by certain groups
Is also known as the Roger Bell Curve and describes how a new product is adopted according to the psychological characteristics of certain user groups
Illustrates the progress of a piece of technology through a pattern of overenthusiasm and disillusionment

questions.explanation: The Technology Adoption Lifecycle, also known as the Roger Bell Curve, describes how a new product is adopted according to the psychological characteristics of certain user groups.

questions.question: It is predicted that the Nexus of Forces will drive 90% of growth in the IoT market.
questions.explanation: The Nexus of Forces are the major drivers of IT market expansion.

questions.question: The first phase of the Gartner Hype Cycle is:
questions.explanation: The first phase of the Gartner Hype Cycle is 'Technology Trigger' because this phase marks the initial introduction and excitement surrounding a new technology.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option.

answers.answer: In the Slope of Enlightenment the adoption of a piece of technology accelerates
In the Trough of Disillusionment, the overenthusiasm of a piece of technology results in expectations being met.
In the Technology Trigger is when a piece of technology has already been hyped up.
In the Peak of Inflated Expectations is when a piece of technology begins to become hyped up

questions.explanation: In the Peak of Inflated Expectations, a piece of technology begins to become hyped up, leading to unrealistic expectations and eventual disillusionment.

questions.question: An aggregator is a website that accumulates different types of information from various sources online.
questions.explanation: An aggregator is a website that accumulates different types of information from various sources online.

questions.question: YouTube is an example of a web aggregator.
questions.explanation: YouTube is an example of a web aggregator because it gathers and hosts a wide range of video content from various sources.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option. In Fitts' Law a touch target:

answers.answer: Should be large enough so that users can easily tell them apart and slowly select them
Should have minimal spacing between them
Should be placed in areas that are easy to reach by the user
Should be small so that more targets can be fit onto the screen

questions.explanation: In Fitts’ Law, a touch target should be placed in areas that are easy to reach by the user to optimize user interaction.

questions.question: A mental model is how we think a system works.
questions.explanation: A mental model is indeed how we think a system works, representing our understanding of how things operate.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option. If every website followed the same convention:

answers.answer: Everything would become boring to look at and use
It would lead to a decrease in frameworks
It would allow you to use other sites easier and quicker
It would make it harder for a user to remember how to use any of the sites

questions.explanation: If every website followed the same convention, it would allow users to use other sites easier and quicker because they would have a consistent and familiar user experience.

questions.question: Fitts' Law explains how a big object takes more time to click on.
questions.explanation: Fitts' Law explains that larger objects take less time to click on, making it quicker to interact with bigger targets.

questions.question: An average adult human's finger pad is:
questions.explanation: An average adult human's finger pad is typically in the range of 10-14mm.

questions.question: User Experience Design is:

answers.answer: The process of improving customer satisfaction and loyalty
The process of decreasing customer satisfaction and loyalty
The process of increasing producer satisfaction and devotion
The process of enhancing customer disappointment and loyalty

questions.explanation: User Experience Design is the process of improving customer satisfaction and loyalty because its primary goal is to enhance the overall user experience, leading to greater satisfaction and loyalty.

questions.question: Goal-Directed Design is understanding the needs, desires and contexts of people using products.
questions.explanation: Goal-Directed Design is indeed about understanding the needs, desires, and contexts of people using products.

questions.question: A represented model is:

answers.answer: How a user thinks a system works
How a system is presented to a user
How a system looks to a user

questions.explanation: A represented model is how a system is presented to a user because it represents the user's perception of the system.

questions.question: A persona is a document describing how:

answers.answer: A population will use your website
A specific person will use your website
Certain types of people will user your website
A specific person will not use your website

questions.explanation: A persona is a document describing how certain types of people will use your website.

questions.question: A Task Model shows what users do, the behaviors they adopt, and doesn't show the requirements at each stage.
questions.explanation: A Task Model shows what users do and the behaviors they adopt but does show the requirements at each stage.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option.

answers.answer: How a website works is more important than how it looks, which is more important than how it feels
How a website feels is more important than how it looks, which is more important than how it works
How a website looks is more important than how it works, which is more important than how it feels
How a website looks is more important than how it feels, which is more important than how it works

questions.explanation: The priority of how a website should be designed, according to user experience principles, is that how a website feels (its usability and user experience) is more important than how it looks, which, in turn, is more important than how it works.

questions.question: Cognitive dissonance is how the brain:

answers.answer: Tries to keep its emotions in check
Tries to believe something that makes sense

questions.explanation: Cognitive dissonance refers to how the brain tries to rationalize two contradictory concepts.

questions.question: Desire Lines is the path of great resistance and it is the easiest way to people to your preferred outcome.
questions.explanation: Desire Lines represent the path of least resistance, making it the easiest way for people to reach their preferred outcome.

questions.question: The three elements of scarcity are:
questions.explanation: The three elements of scarcity are infrequent, exclusive, and competition

questions.question: Commercial design is creating an interface that makes the users emotionally evolved in doing something that benefits:
questions.explanation: Commercial design aims to create an interface that emotionally engages users in doing something that benefits themselves and the designer

questions.question: Flattery makes people less responsive to persuasion.
questions.explanation: Flattery makes people more responsive to persuasion.

questions.question: You create desirability for a product by using:

answers.answer: Secrecy, scarcity, identity, aesthetics and functionality
Secrecy, excess, identity, aesthetics and functionality
Openness, excess, identity, aesthetics and functionality
Secrecy, scarcity, dissimilarity, aesthetics and functionality

questions.explanation: To create desirability for a product, you use secrecy, scarcity, identity, aesthetics, and functionality.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option.

answers.answer: Hick's Law is about presenting information in a way that overwhelms people
Hick’s Law is about presenting information that doesn’t overwhelm people
Hick’s Law is about giving the user multiple options to make decision making easier
Hick’s Law is about not giving the user multiple options to make decision making harder

questions.explanation: Hick's Law is about presenting information that doesn't overwhelm people, therefore reducing their cognitive load.

questions.question: Cognitive load is the amount of mental resources needed to understand something.
questions.explanation: Cognitive load refers to the mental resources needed to process something.

questions.question: Which concept does Miller’s Law focus on?
questions.explanation: Miller's Law focuses on the concept of chunking, which involves breaking information into smaller, manageable chunks.

questions.question: WebAssembly is:

answers.answer: Proprietary software that generates a binary code format for executable programs
Based on the structured and stack machine programming paradigms
A language that worsens performance for applications on web pages
A compiler that converts high-level programming languages down into machine language for browsers

questions.explanation: WebAssembly is based on the structured and stack machine programming paradigms because it's a binary instruction format designed for safe and efficient execution on web browsers.

questions.question: WebAssembly is a replacement for JavaScript.
questions.explanation: WebAssembly is not a replacement for JavaScript; it's a complementary technology designed to work alongside JavaScript

questions.question: Micro Frontends are also referred to as:
questions.explanation: Micro Frontends are also referred to as 'Frontend Monolith' because they are a way to break down a monolithic frontend into smaller, independently deployable parts.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option:

answers.answer: Continuous Integration and Deployment consists of Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment
Continuous Integration and Deployment describes the process of manually building, testing and deploying code changes
Continuous Integration and Deployment consists of Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment
Continuous Integration and Deployment is where an app has to manually be released to production

questions.explanation: Continuous Integration and Deployment consists of Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment.

questions.question: Low-Code is a method of creating applications using graphical tools but still give the user the option of writing code if they want to.
questions.explanation: Low-Code allows users to create applications using graphical tools but still provides the option of writing code if desired.

questions.question: A design’s concept should solely be determined by the users.
questions.explanation: A design's concept should be determined by the users because user-centered design focuses on meeting user needs and preferences.

questions.question: Branding is how a company:

answers.answer: Tries to engage with its audience and how it makes them feel
Purposefully creates a negative image of themselves so that you stay away from them
Does not engage with its audience

questions.explanation: Branding is how a company tries to engage with its audience and how it makes them feel.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option:

answers.answer: Composition is the placement of visual elements on a page
A bad composition will create visual interest
Composition is the deliberate placement of information in a way that overwhelms the user
A composition can only be complex

questions.explanation: Composition is indeed the placement of visual elements on a page.

questions.question: You can create hierarchy with scaling, placement, and color:
questions.explanation: Hierarchy in design can be created through scaling, placement, and color.

questions.question: You define the success of a design through:

answers.answer: Progressive Enhancement, Graceful Degradation, and Performance

questions.explanation: The success of a design is defined through Accessibility, Usability, and Sustainability.

questions.question: Postel's Law follows the concept of:

answers.answer: Be liberal in what you do, be conservative in what you accept from others
Be progressive in what you do, be radical in what you accept from others
Be conservative in what you do, be liberal in what you accept from others
Be radical in what you do, be progressive in what you accept from others

questions.explanation: Postel's Law follows the concept of 'Be conservative in what you do, be liberal in what you accept from others'.

questions.question: Peak-end rule includes only positive peaks.
questions.explanation: The Peak-end rule includes both positive and negative peaks.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option:

answers.answer: Progressive Enhancement is the access to very complex content and functionality
Progressive Enhancement is where functions are progressively removed based on a client’s capability
Progressive Enhancement is the access to simple content and functionality
Progressive Enhancement is the focus on providing the user with more advanced criteria and provides fallbacks

questions.explanation: Progressive Enhancement involves providing access to simple content and functionality first, with more advanced features available for capable clients.

questions.question: Cognitive bias is a rationality in judgement that influences our decision-making abilities.
questions.explanation: Cognitive bias refers to the irrationality in judgment that influences our decision-making abilities.

questions.question: People remember their positive experiences more clearly than their negative ones.
questions.explanation: People tend to remember their positive experiences more clearly than their negative ones.

questions.question: One of Dieter Rams 10 Principles of good design include:
questions.explanation: - TRUE. One of Dieter Rams' 10 Principles of good design is 'Innovative' because good design often involves creative and forward-thinking solutions.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option:

answers.answer: Affordances are relative to the system and its ability to interact with the user
Affordances are relative to the individual and their ability to interact
Affordances come from our understanding of our relationship with the virtual world

questions.explanation: Affordances in design are relative to the individual and their ability to interact because they depend on the user's perception and understanding of how elements can be used.

questions.question: Flat design is a UI design that focuses on using 2D elements to create form/function.
questions.explanation: Flat design is indeed a UI design approach that focuses on using 2D elements to create form and function.

questions.question: Material Design is inspired by the:
questions.explanation: Material Design is inspired by the physical world, drawing inspiration from real-world materials and their behaviors.

questions.question: Which one of the following is part of the Human Interface design principle.
questions.explanation: Metaphors are part of the Human Interface design principle because they provide familiar symbols and representations for users to understand and interact with digital interfaces.

questions.question: IOS uses Material Design and Android uses Human Interface.
questions.explanation: iOS typically follows Human Interface Guidelines (HIG), while Android often uses Material Design as their respective design principles.

questions.question: What makes good mobile site?
questions.explanation: A good mobile site is made by prioritizing UX Research, ensuring that the design is based on user needs and behaviors.

questions.question: Which of the following is a context-aware learning rule?
questions.explanation: Incremental learning and updating is a context-aware learning rule, as it involves adapting and updating knowledge based on changing contexts.

questions.question: Mobile AR is disadvantaged by the widely distributed base of hardware like smartphones and tablets.
questions.explanation: Mobile AR is advantaged by the widely distributed base of hardware like smartphones and tablets because almost everyone has them.

questions.question: VR is:

answers.answer: An immersive 2D environment that you can interact with
An environment you can only currently access through specialized equipment
An interface that overlays digital information with reality
An environment that anchors and overlays virtual objects to the real world

questions.explanation: VR (Virtual Reality) is an environment you can currently access through specialized equipment, such as VR headsets.

questions.question: Which field is AR the most prominent in?
questions.explanation: AR (Augmented Reality) is most prominent in the field of Gaming, where it is widely used to enhance gaming experiences by overlaying digital elements on the real world.

questions.question: Context-aware applications use information about a person to improve their user experience.
questions.explanation: Context-aware applications use information about a person to improve their user experience by personalizing content to their liking.

questions.question: You create consistency in design through:
questions.explanation: You make consistency in design through visual, functional, and external consistencies, ensuring that elements look, behave, and are positioned consistently.

questions.question: Pick the most correct option:

answers.answer: You should rely on color to differentiate between information and objects
You should never use color for communication
You should consider how your use of color is viewed in other countries
You should not think about how True Tone displays affect color

questions.explanation: You should consider how your use of color is viewed in other countries to ensure cultural sensitivity and accessibility.

questions.question: Motion focuses on attention and maintains continuity through feedback and transitions.
questions.explanation: Motion in design focuses on attention and maintains continuity through feedback and transitions.
